intro: Parsonsia densivestita, commonly known as the dense-haired parsonsia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, often orange or yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Parsonsia densivestita is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
